abstract: The apparent success of JPMorgan’s two investment banking heads prompted The Big Money to look at other power-sharing arrangements on Wall Street over the years.
snippet: The apparent success of JPMorgan’s two investment banking heads prompted The Big Money to look at other power-sharing arrangements on Wall Street over the years.
lead_paragraph: Sharing power has never been easy on Wall Street, but JPMorgan Chase’s two investment banking bosses, Steve Black and Bill Winters, appear to be making it work. Their success prompted Duff McDonald, writing for Slate’s business Web site, The Big Money, to look at other power-sharing arrangements on the Street over the years — and decide who won and who lost in each.

headline.main: When Two Is a Crowd on Wall Street

abstract: The market for M.&A. could see some real growth in the coming months after over a year of declining deal volume, according to a new study by Thomson Reuters and JPMorgan Chase.
snippet: The market for M.&A. could see some real growth in the coming months after over a year of declining deal volume, according to a new study by Thomson Reuters and JPMorgan Chase.
lead_paragraph: The market for mergers and acquisitions could see some real growth in the coming months after more than a year of declining deal volume, according to a new joint study published on Tuesday by Thomson Reuters and JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: Study Projects Upsurge in M.& A. Activity
